para.text: control when heads, drawdowns, or budget terms will be saved. For

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; tabstops:none;
li.text: First N times steps and each N'th time step thereafter

para.text: (The head, drawdown, or budget term for the last time step in the stress period is also printed or saved.)

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; tabstops:none;
li.text: Last time step of each N'th stress period

para.text: (The head, drawdown, or budget term for the last stress period is also printed or saved.)
The first choice is the default for
is 1. If the defaults are used, the head, drawdown, or budget term will be printed or saved at the end of every time step. If the output files become very large, it may be convenient to change either

or both. Typically, head, drawdown, and the budget will change most rapidly during the first few time steps of a stress period. Therefore ModelMuse is designed so that if data is being printed or saved for every stress period, it will always be printed or saved for the first
time steps so that these crucial time steps can be checked.
